Name: Warrior of Chaos
Description: Whenever you roll a 1 on an attack roll you may choose to hit instead, but you also take the damage your attack dealt.

Name: Chaotic Failure
Description: Once per long rest when you roll a 1 with a d20 you can forgo gaining inspiration and instead roll on the {@table wild magic surge|phb} table. If the effect would result in you regaining all your sorcery points, you can instead regain the highest level spellslot you have spent or a hit die.

Name: Elemental Chaos
Description: Whenever you finish a long rest in an area with a lot of Chromatic Orenth of a different element, you may choose to become the genasi associated with that element instead. Additionally once per Short Rest when a creature within 60 feet of you takes Elemental damage you may use your reaction to deal an additional 2d4 damage to them. Both of the damage dice are of Elemental damage types of your choice.

Name: Prismatic Breath
Description: Whenever you use your breath weapon, you may choose to deal any type of Elemental Damage. You count as any type of chromatic dragonborn for the sake of trait prerequisites

Name: Warrior of Flame
Description: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may deal an additional 2d6 fire damage to the target.

Name: Warrior of Spores
Description: Whenever you crit on an attack roll you may also deal 1d8 psychic damage to the target and any creature of your choice within 15 feet of them.

Name: Mind Poison
Description: Once per turn when you deal poison damage you may also deal 1d4 psychic damage.

Name: Warrior of Storm
Description: When you deal damage to a target it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Warrior of Water
Description: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you have a swimming speed it increases by 15 feet.

Name: Warrior of Wind
Description:
Whenever you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to push it 15 feet in a horizontal direction of your choosing.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once) and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Smell of Fear
Description: You are aware of all creatures with the {@condition frightened} condition within 120 feet of you. You can't have disadvantage on attack rolls against them.

Name: Weatherman
Description: You may force a reroll of the weather. Additionally you are unaffected by conditions imposed due to extreme cold, wind or rain.

Name: Warrior of Wood
Description: Whenever you hit with an attack roll you may deal an additional 1d4 poison damage. For the next minute, at the start of every turn the creature takes an additional 1d4 poison damage and they must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Wisdom modifier), on a success the effect ends. You may use this feature a number of tims equal to your Wisdom modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Endured Suffering
Description: When you cast a spell with a duration and a creature critically fails their saving throw against it, the length of the spell is doubled.

Name: Enhanced Chromatic Breath Weapons
Description: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Wisdom modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

Name: Elemental Connection
Description: You can telepathically communicate with any elemental within 30 feet of you. Additionally you have advantage on Charisma checks when communicating with them.

Name: Elemental Fighting Adept
Description: When wielding a light weapon or sling, you may choose to use your Wisdom in place of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Name: Chromatic Spellcasting
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a spell, you may double your proficiency bonus for the attack roll or Spell Save DC.

Name: Mark of Tiamat
Description: Pick one of the following skills: Persuasion, Intimidation, Deception, Arcana, Nature or Religion. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Wisdom modifier instead of another ability score.

Name: Specific Resistance
Prerequisite: The Ability to cast a spell from the chosen School
Description: You are in touch with a specific type of magic allowing you to tap into how they work. Choose one of the schools of magic. You get advantage on saving throws against spells from that school of magic.

Name: Unnatural Limbs
Description: You gain an additional arm. You can grasp things with your arm, and you can use it as a snorkel. It has a reach of 5 feet, and it can lift a number of pounds equal to five times your Strength score. You can use it to do the following simple tasks: lift, drop, hold, push, or pull an object or a creature; open or close a door or a container; grapple someone; or make an unarmed strike. Your DM might allow other simple tasks to be added to that list of options. It can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

Name: Call of the Sun
Description: Whenever you hit a creature you may force them to make a Charisma saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Charisma modifier). On a failed save they gain the fiend creature type in addition to their normal creature type until they finish a long rest. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Summon the Sun
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a spell that creates bright light, the bright light counts as sunlight for the next hour.

Name: Explosive Crits
Prerequisite: An Orenth trait with the Weapon Mastery subtype.
Description:
Your mastery over your weapon grants you greater efficiency when perfectly striking your opponents. 
When you crit with a weapon that a Weapon Mastery Orenth trait applies to, your dice can explode, meaning when you roll maximum damage on a die you can roll an additional damage die of the same value.

Name: Unusual nature
Description: You don’t require food or drink and you don't need to breathe.

Name: Physical Magic Resistance
Description: You gain resistance to magical bludgeoning/piercing/slashing damage. This resistance disappears until the end of your next turn whenever you take psychic damage.

Name: Elven Eyes
Description: You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you. Additionally the curvature of the planet you are on doesn’t interfere with your eyesight.

Name: Elven Suppleness
Description: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet. You also do not leave footprints.

Name: Focused Expert
Description: When you pick this Orenth you lose proficiency with one skill and gain expertise in another one.

Name: Slow Death
Description: You cannot fail more than 1 death save per round of combat.

Name: The Elvenest Eyes
Description: Once per Long Rest you can ignore the maximum range of a ranged weapon you have proficiency with, instead treating any creature you can see as being within range.

Name: Rage of the Small
Description: Your fury has turned into a rage. Your Fury of the Small damage increases to 2 times your Proficiency Bonus. In addition you can use it a number of times equal to twice your Proficiency Bonus per Long Rest.

Name: Make em Gobble
Description: You learn to put your sharp teeth to good use. You get a bite attack which does 1d4 plus your Strength modifier in piercing damage. You also always add your Fury of the Small damage to this attack, however, it is still limited to once per turn. This does not expend a use of Fury of the Small.

Name: Opportunity of the Small
Description: Your small size gives you a slight advantage against larger foes. In battle you can flank your opponent as long as your ally is on the opposite side of the creature.

Name: Weird Magic
Description:
When a creature casts a spell within 60 feet of you, you may use your reaction to disturb the spell. Roll on the {@table Weird magic table|oreorenth}. The result of your roll applies to the spell cast.
You may use this trait a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses you finish a long rest.

Name: Vampiric Strikes
Description: Whenever you hit with an unarmed strike you may gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses at the end of a long rest.

Name: Mind of the Fey
Description: You may use Wisdom or Intelligence for any Fey Orenth traits. Choose when you pick this trait.

Name: Fey Trance
Description: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a short rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

Name: Eyes of the Feywild
Description: The range of your darkvision increases by 30 feet. Additionally, while in darkness you can discern whether a creature currently has a magic effect on them. An arcana check may reveal the spell school at DMs discretion.

Name: Fey Blood
Description:
If you have the Fey Ancestry trait your creature type becomes fey. If your creature type is fey you gain the Fey Ancestry trait: 
You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.

Name: Feywild Navigator
Description: Choose one of the following skills: Survival, Investigation, Perception, Stealth, or Nature. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Charisma modifier instead of another ability score.

Name: Novice Fey Bargainer
Description: Choose two of the following skills: Persuasion, Deception, Insight. You have advantage in one of these skills and disadvantage in another.

Name: Advanced Gnome Tinkering
Description: When you use your Tinker trait you can also choose to make a machine that emulates any cantrip of your choice. You can activate this machine as an action (no matter the cantrip) while you are within 30 feet of it. The cantrip uses your Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

Name: What do your gnomish eyes see?
Description: You gain 1 foot of True Sight.

Name: Sapphire Weapon Training
Description: Your connection to sapphire dragons provides you with the power to hone your skills with a weapon. Pick one martial weapon, you get proficiency with this weapon and your Gem traits count as Ingens Orenth traits for the purpose of gaining access to higher tier Orenth traits.

Name: Intuitive Gravity
Description: As a reaction to seeing a drop that would result in fall damage, you may roll the damage this fall would cause twice. Your character knows the value of these rolls. Anything that would subsequently take this damage will use your choice of one of the damage rolls instead of rolling for themselves.

Name: Subtle Magic Caster
Description: You've adapted the quiet casting of an Emerald Dragon. When you cast a spell you may choose to ignore verbal and somatic components. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. You regain all uses on a long rest.

Name: Who is who
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, once per long rest when you use your breath weapon you may apply an addition effect to it. Any creature that took damage from your breath gets the spell Disguise Self cast upon them as if you had cast the spell, making them look like you. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you lose concentration.

Name: Illusory Core
Description: This trait counts as an orenth trait of any type. Additionally, you can make your other orenth abilities look like a different type using illusions.

Name: Emerald Fire
Description: Once per turn when you deal fire damage, you may also deal an additional 1d4 psychic damage.

Name: Mental Prowess Estimation
Description:
As a bonus action you can observe the behaviour of a creature to get a sense of their mental state. Make an Intelligence (Insight) check against their Charisma score. On a success you learn which of their mental ability scores is the highest and which is the lowest, and whether they have proficiency in any mental saving throws.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: I'm pretty sure you're willing
Description: You may target an unwilling creature with a spell that requires a willing creature. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your prof. bonus + your Intelligence modifier), on a failure, the spell is cast upon them and you may not use this feature again until you finish a long rest. On a success, you spend the spellslot but nothing happens.

Name: Connected to your Ancestry
Description: You gain a tier 1 trait from the Orenth type related to your original race.

Name: How did I die from that last time?
Description: Pick a non-physical damage type. You gain resistance to this damage.

Name: Undead Skill
Description: Pick one of the following skills: Athletics, Medicine, History, Arcana, Religion, Nature. You gain proficiency in the skill and you can use Constitution instead of the normal ability whenever you make a skill check.

Name: Send them to Sardior
Description:
Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points you may choose to have one of the following things happen, depending on the creature's alignment. You may choose which alignment if the creature has multiple, such as Chaotic Good. 
Good: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of the creature that died gains temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier. 
Evil: Any creature of your choice within 15 feet of the creature that died takes necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. 
Neutral: A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the creature that died can cast a cantrip with a casting time of one action, as a reaction. 
Chaotic: A creature of your choice within 30 feet of the creature that must immediately use its reaction to make a melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. 
Unaligned: A familiar appears in the dead creature's space as if you had cast find familiar. The familiar is undead and remains for 10 minutes. 
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest. After the effect ends the soul of the creature safely passes to Sardior.

Name: Orenth Sense
Description: As a bonus action you can sense what Orenth type a creature is most aligned to and what Orenth traits they have.

Name: Post Mortem Estimator
Description: As an action you can somewhat accurately determine the time that has passed since a creature has died, rounded to an amount of time the DM thinks sounds right at the time. For example, 134 years dead would give you an estimate of 100 years, 25 seconds dead would give you an estimation of 30 seconds dead. You also learn the cause of their death.

Name: Increased Entropy
Description: Whenever you take fire damage your speed increases by 30 feet until the end of your next turn.

Name: Play Dead
Description: Once per long rest you may cast Feign Death on yourself a reaction to taking damage.

Name: Shared Life
Description: While taking a short rest you may take the hit dice of a willing creature who is also taking a short rest and roll them to regain your own hit points.

Name: Psionic Reach
Description: At the start of your turn you can choose to telekinetically fling your weapon across the battlefield. Until the end of your turn your reach becomes 30 feet. You may use this trait a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Psionic Projectiles
Description: Once per turn when you hit with a ranged weapon or spell attack you may choose to pull the creature 10 feet towards you. You may do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Sapping Strikes
Description: Choose a melee weapon that has no properties that you have proficiency with. Whenever you hit a creature with this weapon, it is unable to regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Name: Telekinetic Weapon
Description: Once per turn when you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size larger than you with a melee weapon attack or unarmed strike, you may choose to push it 15 feet in a horizontal direction of your choosing. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier, and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Kobold maleability
Description:
Whenever you finish a short rest in an area where a dragon's presence has an effect on the environment, you may choose to change one of your Orenth traits to one connected to that dragon type. You cannot change this trait in this way.
Additionally you more easily blend in with other kobolds. You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Charisma (Deception) checks made to convince others that you are a different kind of kobold.

Name: Enhanced Gem Breath Weapons
Description: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Intelligence modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

Name: Gem Shell Defense
Description: You gain resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you pick this trait): necrotic, psychic, force, thunder or radiant.

Name: Telepathic Link
Description: As an action, you can psionically link yourself to a willing creature you share a language with. For the next hour, you can mentally communicate with them as long as you are on the same plane of existence or until you create a psionic link to a different creature.

Name: Information Gatherer
Description: Pick one of the following skills: Stealth, Medicine, Insight, Perception, Crafting or Persuasion. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Intelligence modifier instead of another ability score.

Name: Psionic Fighting Adept
Description: When wielding a light weapon or a sling, you may choose to use your Intelligence in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Name: Gem Spellcasting
Description: Once per long rest you may change the saving throw of a spell you cast to an Intelligence saving throw.

Name: Cooling Ears
Description: Because of your big ears you are able to cool off quickly, giving you resistance to fire damage.

Name: Giant's Heritage
Description: The strength of the giants flows within you. You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. You have can also easily acclimate to cold climates and heights.

Name: Craft of the Giants
Description:
Your connection to giants grants you the power to forge and create. Depending on the type of Giant you are connected to you choose one proficiency in an associated tool. If you already have proficiency with this tool your Proficiency Bonus is doubled. 

Fire: Smith’s Tools
Cloud: Gaming Set, Calligrapher's Tools
Frost: Cobbler’s Tools, Leatherworker’s Tools
Stone: Mason’s Tools 
Hill: Cook’s Utensils
Storm: Navigator’s Tools, Cartographer’s Tools, Water Vehicles

Name: Sturdiness of the Earth
Description: You have advantage on saving throws against being pushed or knocked prone, and only get moved half the distance when forcefully moved against your will.

Name: Natural Sprinters
Description: You gain the ability to sprint across the battlefield. Whenever you dash you may choose to move with extreme speed, this also uses up your regular movement. You move three times your movement speed, but the movement must be in a straight line and unobstructed by difficult terrain. While dashing in this way opportunity attacks against you have advantage.

Name: Touched by the Waves
Description: You can give a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus the ability to breathe underwater, including you. You may change these creatures after every short rest.

Name: Brass Camouflage
Description: After you spend a long rest in a town you can choose to resemble the local race and you can understand and speak the local language.

Name: Fearsome Accuracy
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with and that has the Thrown property. As an attack, you may throw your weapon at a creature at the very limit of your range. Make an attack roll against a creature exactly the maximum distance of your range away. If the attack hits, the creature takes normal damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 8+your proficiency bonus + the ability score you used for the attack). On a failure, the creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

Name: Deflective Weapons
Description: Choose a weapon that you have proficiency with that you can dual-wield. While dual-wielding with this weapon you may use a reaction after getting hit to roll a d4 and add the result to your Armor Class, possibly turning a hit into a miss.

Name: Grinding Halt
Description: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with that has the Heavy or Reach property. Whenever you must make a saving throw to avoid being moved against your will, you can dig your weapon into the ground as a reaction. Roll 2d6 and add the number rolled to the saving throw. If the effect pushing you does not have a saving throw, you move 5 feet fewer.

Name: Applicable Weapon Mastery
Description: After you finish a long rest you may apply any Weapon Mastery Orenth trait to a different weapon that meets the requirements.

Name: Spellcasting Weapons
Description: You can choose one weapon you are proficient with and use it as a spellcasting focus.

Name: Blowgun Expert
Description: Whenever you use a blowgun it deals 1d4 + your Dexterity modifier amount of piercing damage. Additionally it gains the Light property.

Name: Stone Tosser
Description: Choose a weapon you have proficiency with, with the Thrown property. The normal and long distances you can throw this weapon doubles.

Name: What do you mean magic?
Description: Whenever you deal damage that triggered due to you hitting with a weapon attack, you can make the damage type the same as your weapon damage.

Name: Crushing Blow
Description: Choose a melee weapon that you have proficiency with and has the Heavy property. As an action you can make a single weapon attack with this weapon, on a hit the target's AC is reduced by 1 until it finishes a Short Rest. Its AC can't be reduced below 10+its Dexterity modifier. This attack deals no damage, and its damage cannot be increased in any way.

Name: Mixed Ancestry
Description: You gain access to all Orenth types and this trait counts as a Tier 1 trait for any type.

Name: The Human Spirit
Description: Your human spirit grants you hope unlike any other. After you finish a long rest you get a point of inspiration.

Name: Stubborn
Description: You know what you like and don’t need anything else. You gain the ability to pick the same Orenth trait twice.

Name: Homing Minotaur
Description: You know where you come from, and more importantly how to get back. Once per long rest you can select a point or object you can see within 30 feet. Until you use this feature again you can always find your way back to this point or object.

Name: Continued Assault
Description: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack you can mark it. The next time this creature takes damage it increases by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus and regain all uses after a long rest. If you critically hit you do not need to expend a use.

Name: Mirage Resistance
Description: Travelling as a nomad through the desert has left you especially well equipped against the illusions of the desert and its dragons. You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made against illusion spells.

Name: Tiny Sneaky Steps
Description: You can hide while travelling at a normal and slow pace, and do an activity at the same time.

Name: Brass Magic Initiate
Description: You learn the message cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

Name: Cacti Gatherer
Description: Whenever you take piercing damage, you may subtract your proficiency bonus from the damage.

Name: Clouds of Shade
Description: As an action, while travelling outside you are able to create a number of small magical clouds equal to your proficiency bonus and assign each of these clouds to a creature of your choice. These creatures have advantage on saving throws against Extreme Heat, as well as saving throws made to avoid elemental damage. You can dismiss the clouds at will.

Name: Magic Item Conversations
Description: You can communicate with any magic item as if you share a language. Its ability to respond in an intelligent manner is based upon its magical power.

Name: Sleep Breath Resistance
Description: Magic cannot put you to sleep. Additionally you can cast the sleep spell once per long rest, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

Name: Innate Knowledge
Description: You can learn about the history of a place simply by staying within the area for an hour. You may attempt to make history checks about a location without having any prior knowledge about it.

Name: Bronze Magic Initiate
Description: You learn the resistance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

Name: Funne man
Description: Whenever you make a pun you can give a creature that laughed temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after a Long Rest. You can still make puns even if you have no more uses remaining.

Name: Copper Magic Initiate
Description: You learn the guidance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spell.

Name: Gift of Skill
Description: After a long rest you may choose one of your skill or tool proficiencies and a creature of your choice that you can see. This creature gains that skill proficiency until you designate it or another creature a skill.

Name: Gold Magic Initiate
Description: You learn the true strike cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

Name: I am the Light
Description: Whenever you are blinded, darkness spreads around you. While the condition lasts you have the Darkness spell cast centered on you. If the spell is dispelled you are no longer blinded.

Name: Silver Magic Initiate
Description: You learn the spare the dying cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

Name: Silver Spellcasting
Description: When you cast a beneficial spell on an ally you may also give them a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier. You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses at the end of Long Rest.

Name: Enhanced Metallic Breath Weapons
Description: Your breath weapon deals 1d10 extra damage, and you may calculate the save DC using your Charisma modifier instead of your Constitution modifier.

Name: Metallic Fighting Adept
Description: When wielding a light weapon or sling, you may choose to use your Charisma in place of Strength of Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Name: Humanoid Guide
Description: Choose one of the following skills: Crafting, Arcana, Religion, History, Medicine or Nature. Whenever you make a check with this skill you can choose to use your Charisma modifier instead of another ability score.

Name: Celestial Blood
Description: Your creature type becomes Celestial and when you cast the light cantrip you can have two lights active.

Name: Hands of Greater Healing
Description: You may roll d6s instead of d4s whenever you use your Healing Hands ability.

Name: Improved Celestial Revelation
Description:
You gain the following benefit, depending on your chosen revelation: 
Necrotic Shroud: You can frighten creatures up to 20 feet away and you may deal radiant damage instead of necrotic damage. 
Radiant Consumption: The aura’s size increases to 20 feet and you can choose to exclude a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier, who won’t take the damage. 
Radiant Soul: Your flying speed increases by 20 feet.

Name: True Helper
Description: You can take the help action even if you have no proficiency in the skill or tool.

Name: Merciful Warrior
Description: Any damage you deal can be non-lethal. Additionally you have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks to stabilize a creature.

Name: Trench Coat
Description: You have (or find) a buddy on whose shoulders you stand and together you pass as a larger humanoid. You gain the following benefits: You have advantage on saving throws made against being charmed; You have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid being knocked prone; You gain additional hit points equal to your level; When you drop to 0 hit points your buddy dies instead of you and you revert back to your untrenchcoated form. You lose this trait and can pick a different trait that you apply for.

Name: Quick Casting
Description: Choose a spell that you can cast with a casting time of an Action. Once per Long Rest you may cast this spell as a bonus action.

Name: Mastered Teleportation
Description: Choose a spell that allows you to teleport. Whenever you cast this spell you may double the distance you can teleport with it.

Name: Equinox
Description: Around the equinoxes, the days and nights are balanced and last equally long. Whenever you fail a d20 check you made with disadvantage, you may add 1d4 to your next d20 check.

Name: Painting Eggs
Description: You gain proficiency with Painters Supplies. Additionally, over the course of a short rest you can paint eggs with a pretty pattern and give them to your friends. As a reaction to failing a d20 during the next day they made look at the egg and roll 1d4 and add it to the check, possibly turning it into a success. You can make a number of eggs equal to your Wisdom modifier every short rest.

Name: Rope Capture
Description:
On your turn you may use 15 feet of rope to wrap a creature up. You must use your movement to fully loop around the creature, ending the movement in the place you started. You can then use your bonus action to try and tighten the rope and restrain the creature. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your Proficiency Bonus + your Dexterity modifier. The target succeeds automatically if it’s Huge or larger. On a failed save, the target has the Restrained condition until it unentangles itself. To escape, the target must use its action to make a DC 10 Strength (Athletics) check, escaping on a success.
A creature within 5 feet of the target can use its action to attempt the same thing. Destroying the rope (AC 10; 5 HP; immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage) also frees the target, ending the effect.

Name: Chug! Chug! Chug!
Description: You can drink a healing potion as a bonus action and still restore all the maximum amount of hit points.

Name: Channel the Weather
Description:
Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack while outside, you may apply one of the following benefits, depending on the current weather: 
Heat: Your attack deals an additional 1d6 fire damage
Cold: Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 cold damage
Wind: After hitting with a weapon attack you may immediately move 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. This movement doesn't cost you any movement. 
Rain: Your attacks deal an additional 1d6 acid damage. 
Storm: At the start of the day pick either the Wind or Rain benefit.

Name: Harvest of the Land
Description: When performing the Foraging travelling activity and you find enough food for your party, you can give your party an additional benefit in addition to a full stomach. Anyone that eats from the food you find may add your Wisdom modifier to one of the hit dice they roll to regain hitpoints.

Name: Amethyst Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled transmutation spell you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Crystal Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled divination spell you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Jade Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled enchantment spell you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Emerald Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled illusion spell you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Sapphire Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled abjuration spell you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Topaz Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a levelled necromancy spell you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Absorbant Recovery
Description: Once per short rest when you take damage that you are resistant to you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Pious Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you gain piety you may also regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Life Absorption
Description: Once per long rest when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell you cast, you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Trans Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you may spend 8 hours trancing during a short rest and regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Unlucky Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you roll a natural 1 on a d20 check you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: No Energy Wasted
Description: Once per long rest when a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a spell you cast resulting in nothing happening, you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Recovery in a Moment of Peace
Description: Once per long rest when you get grappled, restrained, stunned, exhausted, charmed, frightened, slowed, dazed or paralyzed against your will you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Mind and Body Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you regain hit points from a levelled spell you also regain a first level spell.

Name: Feywild Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you teleport you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Recovery from beyond the Grave
Description: Once per short rest when you are reduced to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Gish Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you crit with a weapon attack you regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Tinkerer's Recovery
Description: Over the course of a long rest your may imbue an item with arcane energy. Before you next long rest you may unleash the energy inside the item as a bonus action to regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Ritual Recovery
Description: Once per long rest you may perform a 10 minute ritual to enhance your power. At the end of the ritual one of your first level spellslots becomes one level higher.

Name: Recovery of the Breath
Description: Once per long rest when you use your Breath Weapon you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Mind over Body Recovery
Description: Once per long rest during a short rest when you regain hitpoints from rolling hit dice you may refrain from adding your constitution modifier to the roll and regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Extraplanar Recovery
Description: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduces an abberation, fiend or fey to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Lunar Recovery
Description: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce an elemental, undead, celestial or dragon to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Recovery from Nature
Description: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce a plant, beast or ooze to 0 hit points you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Murderous Recovery
Description: Once per short rest when you or a party member reduce a humanoid or giant to 0 hit points, you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Alchemical Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you consume a potion you may also regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Wilderness Recovery
Description: Once per long rest while travelling you may forgo choosing a travelling activity and instead spend the day focusing on your arcane energy, regaining a first level spellslot at the end of the day.

Name: Overcharged Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you upcast a spell you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Ancestral Recovery
Description: Once per long rest when you cast a racial or orenth spell you may regain a first level spellslot.

Name: Chaotic Recovery
Description: Whenever you cast a first level spell roll 1d4. If you roll a 1 you do not expend a spellslot and you must roll on the wild magic table.

Name: Size Smith
Description: Choose a spell you can cast that has a size limitation. You no longer need to abide to the size limitation when casting this spell.

Name: The cold never bothered me anyway
Description: You gain resistance to cold damage. Additionally, you are immune to secondary effects from abilities that deal cold damage.

Name: Deafening Spells
Description: Choose a spell that deals thunder damage. Whenever a creature takes damage from this spell they also become deafened for a number of rounds equal to the amount of damage dice the creature took (or half the amount if they succeeded on a saving throw and only took half damage).

Name: Delayed Casting
Description: Choose a spell that takes an action to cast. Whenever you cast it, you may delay the spell for up to one minute. You must already determine the targets when you initially cast it. At any point during this minute you may use your reaction to cast the spell in the way you specified, using your position when you cast it as the point of origin. If the specified way of casting is no longer possible you loose the spellslot.

Name: Lengthy Rituals
Description: Choose a spell that you can cast as a ritual with a duration. Whenever you cast this spell as a ritual its duration doubles.

Name: Quarterling
Description: Once per long rest you can squeeze through a 1 inch gap.

Name: Tiny Human
Description: You are considered Human for the sake of Orenth and Feat prerequisites.

Name: Centaur Slavers
Description: Celestials have disavantage on saves imposed by you.

Name: But I can carry you!
Description: Another creature can grapple you as a Free Action on their turn if you are willing.

Name: Controlled Gravity
Description: Whenever a creature takes fall damage you may use your reaction to add or subtract 1d6 from the damage.

Name: Tiny Elf
Description: You are considered an Elf for the sake of Orenth and Feat prerequisites.

Name: Original heritage
Description:
You're still connected to your parental heritage even if you're the chosen of one of the moons or sun. You may pick one of the following traits: 
- Fey heritage: You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the charmed condition on yourself.
- Oceanic heritage: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
- Hunter heritage: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet. 
- Little folk heritage: You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill. 
- Magical heritage: You know the prestidigitation, druidcraft or thaumaturgy cantrip. 
- Bestial heritage: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6+your strength modifier in slashing damage. 
- Civilised heritage: You gain proficiency in a tool of your choice and you learn an additional language.

Name: Radiance Bearer
Description: You learn the Sacred Flame cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Whenever you cast this cantrip you also cast Light on the creature if they failed the saving throw.

Name: Celestial Affinity
Description: Your creature type becomes celestial. Additionally, your connection to Bahamut gives you an intuitive understanding of people. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Persuasion, Medicine, Insight or History.

Name: Racial Appropriation
Description: Choose two tier 1 Orenth traits with different racial prerequisites. Whenever you Shapechange into one of these races you also gain access to the chosen Orenth trait tied to it. If they have a limited number of uses, you may use (both of) them a total number of times equal to your Charisma modifier every long rest.

Name: Don't wake the Cosmic Horrors!
Description: Whenever you cast a spell with your Gift of the Svirfneblin or Duergar Magic trait you may do so without using any spell components.

Name: Shifting Objects
Description: As a bonus action you may teleport an object no one is holding or wearing you can see within 60 feet of you, weighing no more than 10 pounds, to another location within 60 feet of you. The objects make a loud popping sound wherever they appear.

Name: Thin Veil of Samhain
Description: You may fail 4 death saves before dying and you regain 1 hit point whenever you roll a 19 or 20 on the die.

Name: Ascension
Prerequisite: Faith in our One true lord Jesus Christ
Description: While you are Dying, you may fly up to 30 feet every round. Whenever the Dying condition ends you may immediately descend down to the ground safely with a speed of 60 feet per round.

Name: Serpent's Fangs
Description: Choose a spell with a line as its area of effect. Instead of creating one line you may instead create two of half the length of the original line when casting this spell.

Name: DMs get to play too
Description: Whenever you succeed on a saving throw against a cool monster ability with a unique secondary effect, you may choose to fail instead, but you take no damage.

Name: Theme Song
Description: There is a constant background music playing alongside your heroic adventures. As a bonus action you may change the style of the music, giving you advantage in a specific skill of your choice until you switch the style again. You may change the music style once an hour.

Name: Ancient Dragon Breath
Description: Whenever you finish a short rest you regain a use of your breath weapon.

Name: Martial Breaths
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath wapon. Additionally, you may replace multiple attacks on your turn with a breath.

Name: Cloud Communication
Description: You can communicate simple ideas to any Beast, Elemental, or Monstrosity that has a flying speed. It can understand your words and can reply in a manner appropriate for their intelligence.

Name: Spell Replication
Description: As a reaction to a first level spell or cantrip being cast within 60 feet of you, you may remember and imprint the spell upon yourself. For the next minute you may cast this spell once (without expending a spellslot), using your Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. You may imprint a spell like this once per long rest.

Name: Tiny Dragon
Description: Your creature type becomes Dragon. Additionally the range of your draconic cry increases by 5 feet.

Name: Brass Kobold Communication
Description: Whenever you are interacting with a creature you mean no harm you are always able to communicate this to them, even if you share no language with them.

Name: Silver Kobold's Healing
Description: Whenever a creature receives temporary hit points within 60 feet of you, you may use your reaction to turn the temporary hit points into proper hit points. You may do so a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier and regain all uses after a long rest.

Name: Weakness Exploitation
Description: Choose a spell that deals damage after a creature fails a saving throw. Whenever a creature rolls a natural one on their saving throw, they take the maximum amount of damage.

Name: Speedy Recovery
Description: Once per short rest, if you reduce a creature from max hit points to 0 hit points over the span of a single turn, you can recover one spell slot of 1st level.

Name: Wild Magic Breath
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, whenever a creature fails the saving throw against your breath by 5 or more they must roll on the wild magic table.

Name: Breath of the Storm
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals Acid, Thunder or Lightning damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, whenever it is storming or raining your breath deals an additional 2d10 damage.

Name: Kobold Trinkets
Description: After every short rest you may roll on the Trinket table and obtain the item you rolled. You have advantage on any checks made to convince people it is something it is not. The DM may rule it to be true on an especially high roll.

Name: Breath of the Desert
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals Fire or Radiant damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, whenever the weather is hot your breath deals an additional 2d10 damage.

Name: Breath of the Arctic
Prerequisite: Dragonborn whose breath deals Cold damage
Description: You gain an additional use of your breath weapon. Additionally, whenever the weather is cold or windy your breath deals an additional 2d10 damage.

Name: Copper Kobold Inspiration
Description: Whenever a creature within 60 feet of you uses their inspiration they don't lose their inspiration if they still fail the check.

Name: White Kobold's Tenacity
Description: Whenever a creature makes an attack roll with advantage and misses within 10 feet of you, you may add your Wisdom modifier to the roll as a reaction, possibly turning it into a hit.

Name: Little Guys Friend
Description: As a travelling activity you may try and find a little friend. Make a Charisma or Wisdom (Survival) check against the creature's stealth. On a success you find a local creature of CR 1/4 or lower who becomes charmed by you for the next 24 hours. You may repeat the travelling activity the next day to extend the charm and the charm ends early if you or one of your allies harms it. If the creature is reduced to 0 hit points it doesn't die but instead runs away never to be seen again.

Name: Spiky Darts
Description: You may use your cactal spikes as ranged weapons too. You may use your strength or dexterity for attack and damage rolls. They have a short range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

Name: Plant Adaptations
Description: Whenever you finish a short rest you may change your appearance to more closely resemble the local flora. You gain advantage on your stealth check when using your False appearance trait.

Name: Naiad
Description: You can breathe water. Additionally, while fully submerged underwater you are invisible.

Name: Painful Hug
Description: Whenever you get grappled by a creature you may use your reaction to push your spikes into them. They must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC=8+your proficiency bonus+your Constitution modifier). On a failed save they take piercing damage equal to twice your level and you can make a Dexterity save to escape the grapple. On a successful save they take damage equal to your level.

Name: Wind Genasi
Description: You gain resistance against cold damage and you are considered a Wind Genasi for trait prerequisites. You may pick this trait without it taking up an Orenth trait, but then you loose your resistance against lightning damage.

Name: Lightning Genasi
Description: You may cast the Witch Bolt spell with this trait. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for the spell. You can't cast it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. You are also considered a lightning genasi for trait prerequisites. You may pick this trait without it taking up an Orenth trait, but then you loose your ability to cast Feather Fall once per long rest.
